TopicTitle: Earthquake just hit Chile. 8.4 Richter Scale.

Articles.Content:
And the bad part is that I live in Chile.

But our buildings are fine.

Tsunami warning on the coast, sucks that a large part of my family lives there.

I will keep you informed as this thing progresses.

And just as I'm writing this, aftershock.

Edited September 17, 2015 by gmpd2000
OMG! Glad you're alright! Yeah, I live in a somewhat earthquake prone area as well! California!

New measurements have been made, bringing it down to 7.9 Richter, still a pretty big quake.

0 deaths as of now.

Holy Himmel!

Good to see no one is dead as of yet. Plenty of injured, I assume?

Earthquakes are quite a hazard. I havent really experienced one myself.

F5 tornadoes, though.... *shivers*

More like getting hammered with earthquakes ... and so far, not really any mention what-so-ever on the news.

  • 5.7 76km WSW of Illapel, Chile 2015-09-16 23:38:05 UTC 35.0 km
  • 6.4 25km W of Illapel, Chile 2015-09-16 23:18:42 UTC 31.1 km
  • 6.2 70km W of Illapel, Chile 2015-09-16 23:16:05 UTC 10.0 km
  • 6.1 44km WSW of Illapel, Chile 2015-09-16 23:03:56 UTC 10.0 km
  • 6.3 71km W of Illapel, Chile 2015-09-16 22:59:17 UTC 47.8 km
  • 8.3 54km W of Illapel, Chile 2015-09-16 22:54:32 UTC 25.0 km

Holy Himmel!

Good to see no one is dead as of yet. Plenty of injured, I assume?

Earthquakes are quite a hazard. I havent really experienced one myself.

F5 tornadoes, though.... *shivers*

The only people who die at this type of stuff here in Chile, is mainly because of:

a)They get scared and they have a heart attack.

b)They don't evacuate the area and tsunami strikes.

c)They live in a mud house and it falls down.

Unless it's really really big (like the 8.8 quake in 2010), buildings won't come down, that means, almost nobody is injured.

More like getting hammered with earthquakes ... and so far, not really any mention what-so-ever on the news.

  • 5.7 76km WSW of Illapel, Chile 2015-09-16 23:38:05 UTC 35.0 km
  • 6.4 25km W of Illapel, Chile 2015-09-16 23:18:42 UTC 31.1 km
  • 6.2 70km W of Illapel, Chile 2015-09-16 23:16:05 UTC 10.0 km

  • 6.3 71km W of Illapel, Chile 2015-09-16 22:59:17 UTC 47.8 km
  • 8.3 54km W of Illapel, Chile 2015-09-16 22:54:32 UTC 25.0 km

Nah, except the 8.3 one, those are aftershocks, anything below 7.0 will be a medium-intensity-quake for us. (most of us, actually).

Edited September 17, 2015 by gmpd2000
There was a blurb of concern about tsunamis for the coast of Chile and for Hawaii; I wonder if there's any concern for those that live on Robinson Crusoe Island?

There was a blurb of concern about tsunamis for the coast of Chile and for Hawaii; I wonder if there's any concern for those that live on Robinson Crusoe Island?

Probably the whole archipelago will be in danger.

Add another to the list, lesser, to the north...

  • 5.3 57km SW of Ovalle, Chile 2015-09-17 00:06:16 UTC 10.0 km

I once experienced a very very small earthquake here in North Carolina that came from Virginia. I was very surprised to see one of my pillows vibrating even after the speaker was turned off, and realized that in fact the whole house was vibrating. That is, iirc, the only time in recorded history that North Carolina has experienced an earthquake.

Of course, no one was hurt by this small earthquake (although in Virginia some plates were knocked off cabinets and were shattered.)

So this story isn't really applicable. All I can say is that that kinda really sacks for all the Chileans.
Sending good thoughts for you gmpd2000. Hope everything goes well down there in Chile.
Yikes that's terrible. I hope you and your family are and stay okay!

My house shakes every 20 minutes or so.

Aftershocks sure are fun, aren't they?

Also, thanks for the kind replies, guys.

My family is safe, coastal cities were evacuated.
It sounds like some people got hurt, sadly.

I moved out of Santiago 6 months ago.

I know exactly what this crud feels like.

My prayers and wishes go out to everyone in my old home.

Latest info says 8.4 Richter Scale.

There appears to be damage in some coastal cities.

I kept monitoring this late into the night here, and saw several more after the last one I posted... as of this morning, the count is 42. There is a tsunami watch in effect.

TSUNAMI THREAT FORECAST

  * ACTUAL AMPLITUDES AT THE COAST MAY VARY FROM FORECAST

    FEATURES. IN PARTICULAR MAXIMUM TSUNAMI AMPLITUDES ON ATOLLS
    WILL LIKELY BE MUCH SMALLER THAN THE FORECAST INDICATES.

  * FOR OTHER AREAS COVERED BY THIS PRODUCT A FORECAST HAS NOT
    YET BEEN COMPUTED. THE FORECAST WILL BE EXPANDED AS NECESSARY
    IN SUBSEQUENT PRODUCTS.

For the past seven years, I have been doing side research on the strong magnitude earthquakes. In this article from the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA), the earthquake that destroyed Japan a few years back actually shifted the earth's axis by nearly 17 centimeters (that earthquake was a 9.0). The one that hit Indonesia before that also shifted the Earth's axis by about 8 centimeters (it was a 7.2). Already, NASA is predicting that once the data is analyzed, we could see another axis shift of between 5 to 12 centimeters. Already, the speculation is in that this will speed up the rotation of the Earth and could possibly affect our N/S axis tilt (as did the other two). What this means is that the northern hemisphere may be knocked further from the sun (and conversely, the southern hemisphere will be closer to the sun) because of the change in degrees of the Earth's wobble. Even during the summer months, the northern hemisphere will experience cooler temperatures by a few degrees.

Talk about catastrophic climate change...

Shhhh... you'll ruin the day of those who think climate change is caused by man.

I remember reading about this, but not from that NASA article. My opinion?... I think we're headed toward another Maunder Minimum. I'll take cold over hot.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¦ My opinion?... I think we're headed toward another Maunder Minimum. I'll take cold over hot.

You wouldn't be saying that if you lived where I do, Winterpeg MB Canada. Anyways, I hope everyone is as okay as they can be in the areas affected. Stay safe people!

the speculation is in that this will speed up the rotation of the Earth

Cheaper launches!
We got the aftershock (I think) yesterday.

We got the aftershock (I think) yesterday.

There where several of them, so I don't think it's THE aftershock.

Unless it's another completely independent earthquake.
